alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Rutherford; Williamson; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 9:11AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Davidson, western Rutherford, southeastern Williamson and southwestern Wilson Counties through 945 AM CST... At 910 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Nolensville, or 12 miles west of Murfreesboro, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Smyrna, La Vergne, Nolensville, Walterhill, Rural Hill, Eagleville, Cedars Of Lebanon State Park, Rockvale, Gladeville and Triune. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 between mile markers 62 and 78. Interstate 840 between mile markers 37 and 74. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Brief heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to minor localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
